topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0: Denver Deployment Technical Overview

body.p: This page introduces deployment and network architectures of the Denver deployment of HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade. During the installation, use the denver template that comes with the installation package.
Note: The Denver deployment is for proof-of-concept (POC) only and is not intended for production environments.

section.title: Network architecture
section.p: The following information describes the network configuration, which must be configured by the network administrator.

row.entry: Boot/initial configuration network for non-KVM region controllers. Untagged
Boot/initial configuration network for KVM region controllers. Untagged
Cloud Management Network. Shared between the Non-KVM and KVM regions.
Consumer Access Network Shared between the Non-KVM and KVM regions.
IPMI/iLO network. Shared between the Non-KVM and KVM regions.
Block Storage Network. Shared between the Non-KVM and KVM regions.
Data Center Management network (accessible to KVM region) and route across multiple data centers.
Tenant Underlay Network for the KVM region
Provider VLAN as an External network (provides that FIP pool for the KVM region).

section.title: Interfaces
section.p: The following are the interfaces being used, based on the technical architecture diagram. You can use more than two interfaces and specific networks to physical networks.

ul.li: Intf0 is mapped to Port1/Bonded Pair
Intf1 is mapped to Port2/Bonded Pair
Intfn are Multiple Provider Networks or SR-IOV interfaces.

section.p: Configure the following routing access lists.

Access iLO network for managing the lifecycle of the node

section.p: CLM, PXE-1, PXE-2, BLS, TUL should use RFC 1918 non-routable IPs to prevent access to these networks from DCM, CTL, or EXT.
DCM, CAN, and EXT should use routable IP addresses. DCM should be restricted to the corporate network.

section.title: Regions
section.p: For installation and maintenance, HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade consists of two logical or conceptual regions: Non-KVM and KVM. You will see these terms used in the installation process. The Deployment Architecture diagram shows an illustration of these two zones.
The Non-KVM region contains the lifecycle manager, to deploy and maintain HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade; and HP Helion OpenStack, a commercial-grade distribution of OpenStack.

The KVM region is the heart of HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade. The KVM region consists of a software platform, providing ultra-reliability and exceptional performance efficiencies for telecommunications networks.

ul.li: Lifecycle manager The lifecycle manager deploys and manages HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade, consisting of a controller running shared services and the nodes required to run DCN (as needed).
Non-KVM Region Controller. Standard IaaS control plane to enable cloud-to-cloud communication.
StoreVirtual/3PAR: Hardware storage array used as backend for Cinder. Support for 3PAR has a similar architecture as StoreVirtual on iSCSI, not Fibre.
KVM Region Controller: Real-time control plane for compute and networking. Contains modified versions of most of the OpenStack components.
KVM Region Compute: Realtime compute node with networking components.
Orchestrator: This could be any application consuming the cloud services.
